data.title: Vindiciae Gallicae and Other Writings on the French Revolution
data.meta_description: Vindiciae Gallicae was Mackintosh’s contribution to the debate begun by Burke’s Reflections on the Revolution in France. A Discourse on the Law of Nature and Nations was the introduction to a popular course of public lectures at Lincoln’s Inn in 1799 and 1800. These lectures provided Mackintosh with an opportunity to complete the evolution of his political thought, to announce his withdrawal of support for the French Revolution, and to criticize former allies from the reform movement.
data.text:
Sir James Mackintosh (author)

Donald Winch (editor)

Vindiciae Gallicae was Mackintosh’s contribution to the debate begun by Burke’s Reflections on the Revolution in France. A Discourse on the Law of Nature and Nations was the introduction to a popular course of public lectures at Lincoln’s Inn in 1799 and 1800. These lectures provided Mackintosh with an opportunity to complete the evolution of his political thought, to announce his withdrawal of support for the French Revolution, and to criticize former allies from the reform movement.

Buy this Book
